      it usually works much better for me to do them together. they each are what gives the other its power

      it's pretty much my standard procedure for music videos. perform the song, with a mix of on screen graphics and real life visual performances

      yes, although 10000 lifetimes will still not be enough to say all of it. i'm thinking about learning to accept this

      yes, but that's only one side of the story

11.2.20  2:20 am   thoughts on syncopation?

      from what i understand, it means non-synchronization and then going back to synchronization. to put it in real world terms, it would be like if a member of NSYNC joined the Backstreet Boys, then came back to NSYNC

11.2.20  1:12 am   How do you make musics?

      sometimes a little reverse psychology is all it takes

11.2.20  1:00 am   am i supposed to keep the eq of an instrument the same for a whole song? i don't know

      leave it alone, UNLESS it sounds bad, OR if you would like to go on an adventure

11.2.20  12:42 am   how does daylight saving time actually work?

      during the spring and summer months, the clock tells you a later time than it actually is. so it makes the evening seem a little lighter and the morning a little darker. this is besides the fact that the evening and morning are both already lighter than they were in the winter, but because of daylight saving, the evening is WAY more lighter, and the morning is ..... only a little bit lighter. it shifts the daylight later by 1 hour. in the springtime, when it changes, you will always hear people saying 'wow i can't believe it's still light at this time of evening', and in the fall when it switches back, you will hear people saying, 'wow i can't believe it's already dark at this time of evening.' However, what you may not hear, but is still said, is similar but reversed comments about the morning. But with a different twist, because it goes in the opposite direction of the way it's been heading. so, for example, in the springtime in the morning, after it changes, people in the early morning will be saying 'well, the mornings have been gradually getting lighter these past few weeks, but they just suddenly got darker again, although i know they are still going to gradually get ligher from here.' and in the fall, in the morning, just after it changes back, people in the early morning will say 'well, the mornings have been getting gradually darker over the past few weeks, but suddenly they just got brighter again, although i know they still will continue to get darker from here.'

11.1.20  11:55 pm   what do you think about the idea of objectivity in regards to music quality? i remember you saying something here before basically saying that if something is popular, then it must be good,

     i never said that

      i'm paraphrasing but that was the gist of it i think.

     i don't agree with that entirely

     but i've also seen you talk about how everyone has different perspectives on things and how everything is good.

     that is a much more attractive idea to endorse

     do you have any thoughts to add about objectivity versus subjectivity in music? or anything creative for that matter?

      objectivity and subjectivity are tools to determine which person is right and which person is wrong. the person who knows the words 'objectivity' and 'subjectivity' is always right, and here's how they do it: first they say 'subjectively', which means people are allowed to disagree. Then, they provide an alternate situation, 'objectively', which means there is only one right answer and you are not allowed to disagree with that. It's sort of like a good cop / bad cop scenario, where the 'subjectivity' scenario gives you a false sense of comfort, thinking it's ok for people to have different opinions, then the hammer comes down when 'objectively' there is only one true opinion, which spells checkmate for the other person of course

11.1.20  10:58 pm   Did you have a random thought for the video "maybe I could eat blades of grass" or was their a meaning of it?

      the idea there was to start a non-song video with music

11.1.20  6:01 pm   do you songs have deep meanings 

      yes

11.1.20  4:46 pm   i am trying to write a play but it is becoming very difficult because I am starting to demand everything in the entire universe of myself. to execute any one of my ideas to its fullest potential will take about two years. this means that if i intend to give my play the time and dedication that it deserves, i will have to spend two years working on one play. the trouble with this is that i have so many ideas that i am so passionate about that it is impossible to commit myself to one over the others. people ask 'what kind of play do you want to write?' as if there is only one answer, as if a person's soul contains only one world. but that isn't really how it works in my experience. there are billions of plays i want to write and they are all equally important to me, but even if i live another thousand years i won't have enough time to do justice to all of them. basically, i am paralyzed by my own unreasonable expectations of myself. have you ever exper ienced t his?

     yes

     do you have any words of wisdom?

      i was going to ask you that

11.1.20  4:30 pm   why is it so fun to play guitar sounds on a piano

      you can blame music for that

      i would prefer to make a new one to be my favorite
